keyword: how many calories are in tuna sandwich
title: How Many Calories Are in a Tuna Sandwich?
meta_description: Learn how many calories are in tuna sandwich, with a full nutrition breakdown including protein, carbs, fat, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Tuna Sandwich?
assumptions: Standard tuna sandwich: 2 slices white bread (60g), 100g drained canned tuna in water, 1 tbsp mayonnaise, chopped celery; no cheese or additional toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bread type, tuna packing (water/oil), mayo amount, brand, and additions like veggies or cheese. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical tuna sandwich contains about 350 kcal and 25 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Switch to whole wheat bread (2 slices)

faqs.q: How many calories are in a tuna sandwich?
faqs.a: About 350 kcal for a standard version with white bread and mayo.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a tuna sandwich?
faqs.a: Roughly 25 g protein, mostly from the tuna.

faqs.q: Does using oil-packed tuna change calories?
faqs.a: Yes, it adds ~50-100 kcal due to extra fat; water-packed is lower.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in a tuna sandwich?
faqs.a: Around 800 mg, mainly from canned tuna and any added salt.

faqs.q: Can I make a low-carb tuna sandwich?
faqs.a: Yes, use lettuce wraps instead of bread to cut ~150 kcal and 30 g carbs.
